pr_title: PLANNER-2135 Remove support for JavaScript expressions from configs

timeline.bodyText:
If the field PARALLEL_BENCHMARK_COUNT_AUTO isn't used any more, it should be removed too.
But that's still used in javadocs, and replacing it with ConfigUtils#THREAD_COUNT_AUTO makes no sense, because not a THREAD_COUNT. One parallel benchmark or 1 solverManager.parallel may actually use multiple threads. So calling it threadCount is confusing. Also,  resolveThreadPoolSize() is a bad name I guess - we can rename that to resolvePoolSize()?
I see 2 options:

rename - ConfigUtils.THREAD_COUNT_AUTO to just AUTO or something more descriptive without being incorrect in some cases like THREAD_COUNT_AUTO. But then every resolveThreadPoolSize() call must have an AUTO option (which is currently the case, so I guess that's fine).
Don't generalize "auto", like it is before this PR (doesn't impact the other changes in this PR).
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: This is why I tend to prefer option 2, as sometimes there are extra values, like UNLIMITED.
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: (But if we find good consistent naming, I don't veto option 1 though.)
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText:
Let's also remove availableProcessorCount:
While "availableProcessorCount / 2" can be usefull (despite no one using it), "availableProcessorCount" is always a bad idea (freezes the computer). It's a loaded gun tied to your leg aimed at your foot. There's no way to miss.
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: We don't catch Exception or Throwable. Catching Throwable could inadvertadly catch an OutOfMemoryException 98% GC usage. Catching exception is less dangerous, but still undesired. Let's just catch NumberFormatException (see parseInt() javadoc for @throws) .
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: change "that ..." to "that must be at least 1."
